page.title: 02HARTLIP VILLAGE, KENT
page.content: { The village of Hartlip 4miles west of Sittingbourne has a present population of 680.The name comes from Hart Leap because of the deer once found there. It's the centre of Kent's cherry and apple orchards.It is a very pretty village & has often won The Best Kept Small Village In Kent competition.It contains many beautiful old houses some dating back 500 years.Many houses have been renovated and there are some fine new executive houses.There are examples of thatched,peg tiled & half timbered houses.The Anglican Church & school,the Methodist church and Village Hall all help to make Hartlip a busy community.There is Christian Fellowship,Young Wives,WI,Bellringing, Pancake Races,Dances and Fetes.
